Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs, ask for extra towels.”
Reviews.Author: Carlos M
Reviews.Content: I can't say the place isn't nice, in fact the location is really good: in the middle of Playa's 5th Ave., with shops, restaurants, and clubs in front and all around. The hotel's beach club is just a block away. At night they have this amazing fire show with dancers. We couldn't sleep the two nights we stayed there, the first room - a suite - faces the 5th Ave so the noise is constant, and to make it worse the a/c unit and ceiling fans did their part with the noise as well. Next morning we switched to a smaller room in the back, and at night the noise was even worst from the clubs down the back street. We had to ask for extra towels, which weren't delivered but were waiting at the security booth for us to go for them, because in both rooms half of the water in the shower goes in the drain, the other half goes outside: there's no door in the shower. The products available in the bathroom (shampoo, lotion, and bath gel) are really good. The Playasia restaurant, which is still shown on the hotel's website as one of the main features, is no longer operating, and also there is no mini-bar in the suite, also advertised in the website.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck. (Blue Parrot Suites)”
Reviews.Author: TravelinIsmerts
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. My husband and I love boutique hotels and usually are very pleased, but this was like staying in a cheap college apartment from the 1980's. Our room was not clean (huge dust bunnies on the floor and on the fans, the sheets had stains on them, and it seemed like the shower had not been cleaned from the previous guest). The cupboards were all crooked and everything else was majorly outdated. We didn't trust the hotel staff - no smiles as we passed them by, just a nod usually, just overall unfriendly and questionable. It rained our 2nd night there, and water came pouring in the front door - we had to put a towel in front of the door crack. Our bathroom also had water constantly on the floor due to the shower - no matter how we turned the shower head, water got out of the shower and pooled on the bathroom floor. We called the front desk 3 times during our stay, each time with no answer. Just a completely disappointing experience. We wished we had stayed in Tulum at our amazing little hotel called Piedra Escondida! We were so happy to leave The Blue Parrot and will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really a nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Mrknuu
Reviews.Content: Good location. Might hear some noise out of 5th Ave. but still quiet. Got their beachclub just two blocks away if you want to party! Enjoyed a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Work in Progress”
Reviews.Author: elcadejo
Reviews.Content: This is very much still a work in progress. This was the site of the Playasia restaurant and the Blue Parrot is now reorganising its accommodation for 2012 on two sites, having demolished the rooms around the beach club itself. The rooms are of the quality one would expect, but there is no wi-fi and the reception is not manned all day. (Instead there is a security booth). There are better centrally-located hotels for the price, but access to the Beach Club and especially its bar in the evenings can be taken as a plus.

Reviews.Title: “beware of your belongings”
Reviews.Author: Jan A
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time in as many years on a daily excursion to Playa from our nearby resort. We loved the beaches last year so decided to spend a day lounging on one of their chairs while we drank some of the best pina coladas in the area. Most of the beach area has been washed away so the view is not the same. The biggest complain though is their staff members. While having a quick dip in the water, my camera disappeared from my zippered beach bag. We alerted the staff and manager who indicated their staff members are checked before and after shifts. One specific staff kept on hovering around us and just prior to swimming had asked if I wanted him to take pictures of me. Once the camera disappeared so did he for at least 30mins. The family of 4 lounging right next to my lounger didn't notice anything out of the ordinary. I provided the manager and staff with a money offer that I didn't think the theif was able to turn down but sadly I returned home without my treasured item. They were kind enough to alert the tourist police to attend my location to what I believed was to take a report. These "tourist" police spoke no word of english. Granted I am in their country and I should learn the language but being the "tourist" police you'd think a pre-requisite should be they too know how to speak another language. They took some minor information and directed me to walk approx 4 blocks to file another report with another person who didn't speak English. Enjoy the camera you snot and hopefully the money you've made from it actually is used to feed your family!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was okay but the nightlife rocks in the area!”
Reviews.Author: surge527
Reviews.Content: Blue Parrot hotel itself is ok. The first room they gave us was a disaster but they were accommodating and switched us right away to a decent and clean room. It was spacious and had all basic ammenities. The reception desk was unusually always closed (only open around 9am til 10pm)... but nonetheless they took care of us. The BEST part of it it's the beach nightclub... you get free entrance (no cover charge) when you are a guest at the hotel. We had tons of fun! there are two different dance floors and it's on the beach! so be aware ladies that you will end up removing your high heels or platforms... sands gets all over and that's the most fun! removing those shoes and dancing all night! This is definitely NOT your hotel if you are looking for peace and quiet, all the main nightclubs are within blocks... so if you are party animals like my husband and I, then I would highly suggest it! No need to pay a cab and no worrying about drinking and driving.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: krashtest
Reviews.Content: If you're staying in downtown playa del carmen, this is probably one of your better choices. It's a good value, rooms are fairly clean, pretty basic. The pool at the suites location is nice to look at, but not practical for swimming. But that's what the beach is there for anyways. And if you wanted a huge pool with a swim up bar you'd be at one of those all inclusive resorts on the riviera maya. The breakfast was lame, just a cup of coffee and some sliced fruit. Get breakfast at a local place, it's worth the extra few dollars It's a great place to stay with a group of friends. Plus you get free admission to the Blue parrot club on the beach at night, and free beach chairs during the day. Those can add up believe it or not.

Reviews.Title: “Another warning at blue parrot club:(”
Reviews.Author: Torcaza
Reviews.Content: Be careful with the staff of this place. We were a party of 8 people and asked for 8 cocktails, the gave us 6 cocktails without alcohol and 2 with alcohol. They assume we were drunk and we were not going to notice that they were stealing us selling drinks without alcohol. We were very polite asking the waiter to change our drinks, but he started yelling at us, he was very rude. We did not want to ruin our night fighting with that guy so we called the manager and we told her what happened. The waiter told us the amount we owed but he did not provide a receipt. I asked him that he must provide a receipt but he told me that I needed some kind of mexican number in order to get a receipt. Very bad experience, do not go there.

Reviews.Title: “Warning for Blue parrot bar/club”
Reviews.Author: mexistu
Reviews.Content: There is a major scam going on at the Blue Parrott bar on 12th Avenue and the beach. On Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights there are street touts outside the entrance "selling" wrist bands to enter the bar. They will promise you a free drink with the band and tell you that all drink are free for the ladies. After paying the guy money for the wrist band to get in you will soon discover that this is all untrue! When we complained to the management and door staff they said that it is not their problem and we would have to talk to the guy who sold us the wrist band. This is clearly a scam co ordinated with The Blue Parrot as the staff at the entrance to the Blue parrott scan the bar code on your wrist band and are fully aware of the guy in the street selling the bands as its the only way to enter the club. When we asked for our money back the manager got violent and threatened to punch us and through us out! Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, but LOUD”
Reviews.Author: lolo4815
Reviews.Content: The Blue Parrot is an OK hotel if you want to be right in the middle of the action. It's in the middle of 5th Av which is great for getting around, but it's LOUD at night with music lasting until about 3 a.m. So I guess if you plan to stay up late and party it would be OK to stay here, but I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for!!”
Reviews.Author: ZsaZsa
Reviews.Content: We were on a 10 day trip in Cancun, but decided to take a day/night trip to Playa del Carmen to show our friends as they had never been to PDC before. We arrived with a small group that afternoon and did the beach clubs/5th Ave stroll - drinks, shopping, drinks, dinner. Only us and another couple were staying overnight, so as we made our way up and down 5th, we would check out the hotel rates of various places. We chose Blue Parrot on 5th and were very pleased. The rate for each room (one was a King, the other two Queens) was about $65/room. This rate included a nice/simple breakfast which consisted of a fresh fluit place and toast out on the beach. It also included the cover for the Blue Parrot club that night as well as beach chairs the next day. The room was cute. Older, but with a modern touch. LOVED it. The shower is in the room and only separated by a cement wall, so if you are just friends it could be a bit awkward for the lack of privacy. I was with my hubby and could care less. The bed was hard, but slept wonderfully. Room amenities included two small bottles of water, shampoo, soap - the usual. I think there also was a coffee machine, but we don't use it so I don't pay that much attention. Noise from the club could be an issue. I opted to stay in that night while the others went to the clubs. Yes, I could hear the music, but it definately didn't keep me up at all. I'd have no problem staying here again, or recommending it to anyone else. In that recommendation, I would be sure to mention that noise could be a problem but for us it wasn't. In fact, the couple that was with us LOVED LOVED LOVED it all. They fell in love with Playa del Carmen immediately, but also with the Blue Parrot hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here ever again”
Reviews.Author: sexysailor
Reviews.Content: From 7am until 8pm, there were workers chisiling concrete in the roof of the hotel directly above our room. Apparently the management thinks that it is OK to rent out the room directly below this kind of activity, and charge high season prices to boot. Not a good place to stay if you are looking for a peaceful and quiet nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “wish we had planned to stay a few extra nights!”
Reviews.Author: beachgurl77
Reviews.Content: We were meeting friends in Playa del Carmen - we arrived 2 nights earlier than they did and we booked at the Blue Parrot on Fifth Avenue. Staff very friendly, rooms very clean and the location was excellent. Stepped right out onto Fifth and all the restaurants and shopping but since the hotel is in a courtyard garden it was really quiet at night. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: hunter9700
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the middle of it all this is your spot! Our room was huge. The staff was super friendly and we could walk to anywhere from great food,to a fun bar ,to the beach all with in steps. Our only complaint was running out of hot water if you like to take long showers

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great service. GOOD VIBES"”
Reviews.Author: pmnguyen1986
Reviews.Content: A friend who has been to Playa del Carmen recommended this hotel to me. It was awesome! It was right off 5th Ave. where all of the action is going on...when we got there it didn't seem like anyone was working but the "front receptionist" was just hanging out at the front of the hotel and came and ran back to help us. Everyone was soooo nice!!! Totally great vibes, so mellow and there for service but just hanging out at the same time. All of Mexico is like that really. Anyway, it was awesome, I loved the ambience of the place. It was like entering a jungle with the vines draped around the main "lobby" of the hotel. The room was cute, it wasn't anything luxurious but def just the right fit for a beachy, jungle paradise, type of trip. Of course it was soooo loud at night b/c of all of the partying going on out on the streets. I don't think any hotel you stay at in Playa near 5th Ave. will be quiet and serene. C'mon, it's 5th avenue! Anyway, I def recommend this place. Great bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: lilcookie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Blue Parrot this week. We had originally booked for only 2 nights, but a problem with another hotel brought us to Blue Parrot 2 days early. The staff was very accommodating and was able to let us stay the extra 2 nights. The hotel's decor is definitely different, modern, lots of stone, but very comfortable. The only thing I would have wanted in the room was a chair so that you didn't have to sit on the bed all the time. The hotel is right on 5th Ave., but the rooms are set back a little so that the noise was not a problem.Great location for people watching. In addition, the hotel has 2 other locations and we made use of the beach club's facilities. The professional, friendly staff helped make a dinner reservation for us and facilitated our transport to the airport. We received very good service, and help with our bags, in spite of the hotel being obviously short-staffed, trying to manage all the locations. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terebv
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, located on the heart of 5th Avenue. Small but clean rooms. Noisy at night since it is located in the middle of Playa del Carmen's night life area. Great place to choose if you want to party and have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Worst restaurant in the world”
Reviews.Author: Themexicancritic
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation in the restaurant Playasia, the arriving time supose to be at 9:00 pm, I arrived five minutes before the hour and the stupid hosstess told me, "It is missing five minutes, I don't have yor table" ok we wait for five minutes, at 9:00 pm, i asked for my reservation she told me I am sorry i wont have any table available today, I made the reservation because the Valentin's day, so because the hostess my wife and me couldn't take dinner in the playasia, just because the hosstess cancelled my reservation, I will never recommend that restaurant because if you are planning a special romantic night, they gonna make everything to give you the worst romantic night in your life.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevip
Reviews.Content: Blue Parrot is a smaller hotel that have rooms some people own and rent out from time to time. Our room was on the second floor and only 1 room away from the beach so we had a great view. Balcony has chairs and a nice hammock so you can just sit right there all day or head down to the beach and sit on the chairs. Room was nice, had fridge and microwave and small TV. Internet costs extra while we were there and most of the time didnt work. Out of everything that was my only complaint about the hotel. There are several night clubs close to the hotel blaring music but from our room is was not that bad. We did rent a car while on our trip which is very expensive, but it gave us freedom to travel all over the Yukatan.. be careful parking as I got a ticket even after a police man said I could park where I was parking.. As usual in Mexico they take your license plate away and it happenend to be our last day so had no time to figure out where it was taken too so we just paid our 100$ fine to the rental company and made it to the airport just in time to head home.. All in all a great trip just costly, but at least the hotel was reasonably priced.. would love to go back and would stay at the Parrot again..

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel - Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: DesignScout
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our first trip to Playa del Carmen. This hotel was the absolute best location we could have had. It is right in the heart of the main strip, 5th Avenue. You enter the hotel through the restaurant Playasia, it is a tropical haven, filled with vines and palm trees and a river with Coy fish. We had a balcony overlooking the courtyard of the restaurant, and another overlooking 5th Avenue. It was surprising just how quite 5th Avenue became at 10 pm, yet it was so busy all day and evening. We didn't hear a peep from our balcony, except for the morning we awoke to mariachi band - so wonderful! Our suite was airy and cool with all marble floors, a unique open shower (behind a wall) and living room. The review complaining about the shower and the shallow sink, as well as the air freshener has some points, but how critical can you be? None of those petty things impacted my boyfriend and I's stay in the least. We loved our home away from home. The staff was incredibly courteous, as well as helpful when booking our one night away at a cabana in Tulum and our tours. For those of you considering staying at an all-inclusive resort in Playa, we highly recommend this instead. Why pay for your pick of three restaurants with mediocre food when you can stay in the heart of it all (literally hundreds of people walking past your room every ten minutes at it's peak). We were 100 feet from a great Mexican fine-dining seafood restaurant, a wine bar and an Italian restaurant. There are hundreds of places within blocks. No need to catch a ten dollar cab ride back to our fort, i.e. resort. Around the corner is the Blue Parrot Beach Club where you can enjoy lounge chairs on the beach for free if you're staying at 5th Avenue. We didn't miss being on the ocean at all. We're city dwellers.

Reviews.Title: “Shocked and disappointed”
Reviews.Author: travelbug843
Reviews.Content: We booked 8 days at the Blue Parrot on 5th for our Christmas/NYE vacation. Upon checking in, I was immediately wary because the reception area was pretty seedy: stuffy little room, tiny desk staffed by clueless employee, large refrigerated unit selling snicker bars and red bull, plus it was dirty. After procuring the key, I walked into the room and stood in shock for a minute, then walked back to the reception area to inquire where I could find an Internet cafe. I was going to find somewhere else to stay. First, the rooms are TINY. We had 3 girls staying in a room with 2 double beds, and after setting down each of our suitcases onto the available floor space, there was no where else to move. There are no dressers or drawers to store your things. The only storage available is an itty-bitty closet with 3 shelves and 3 hangers. lol. Yeah, right! Second, and most shocking, there was no private bathroom. The only thing with a door was the toilet placed in the corner next the closet, which was inside a tiny little room (i.e. it would hold a water heater and not much else). The shower was in the opposite corner behind the door, and was constructed with a partial (80%) wall that opened up to a walk-in shower. In other words, no door-no privacy. Unless you wanted to undress/dress inside the shower, you had to strip down in the middle of the room first. The sink was so shallow we spilled water everywhere whenever it was turned on; however, that wasn't the worst of it! The sink and countertop were a built-in on the wall opposite the beds, and in the tiny room we found ourselves in that meant that we could wash our faces a mere 3' from where we (and our friends) were sleeping. Soooo not conducive to allowing anyone privacy whilst getting ready nor sleep while another person takes care of hygiene. The best part of the shower arrangement, is that in the heat and humidity that makes up the Mexican climate, the added steam from the open-air shower made the room reek of mildew and mold. The hotel did its best to disguise the stench by installing a self-timed air refresher that squirt a blast of something called "Refreshing Apple" every 10 minutes. It didn't work, and we shut it off so that we could sleep without the disruption. After surveying these first two haunting points, we sat down to discuss our options. WOW! The beds were beyond acceptable. Through the comforter, I could feel the circular shape of each spring pushing against me. Inside the bed later that night, I tossed and turned trying to find a position that didn't cause pain from the springs pushing into my ribs, hips, shoulders, etc. Management needs to wise up to the invention of the mattress pad! We also had some unwelcome visitors in our beds that (only) night. We all woke up with a handful of bug bites on our bodies. As if sleep weren't elusive enough that night, our room was located on the first floor. We were a few feet away from the restaurant that fills the common area. Luckily for the guests, the restaurant rarely sees patrons, but that didn't stop the staff from making their own noise. At 2am when the restaurant shut down, we heard the racket of plates, flatware, and glasses being put away. The staff shouted instructions and conversation to each other from across the room, and turned up the tunes to keep themselves entertained. I finally nodded off around 4am with earplugs wedged into my ears trying to stifle out the sounds from their stereo. Unfortunately, the Blue Parrot has a hefty penalty for late cancellations. If we were to walk out, we would have still been require to pay 50% of our total bill. Fortunately, the Blue Parrot had another property called the Blue Parrot Suites. We were forced to pay double our original rate ($190 to $380) in order to find comfort, but we were so relieved that we took the room and ran the next morning. I did try to work with the manager to right the penalty that we were now shouldering. She did provide a small discount on our new room, but I really think that they could have done more. Even after providing a list of our complaints regarding 5th, we still were charged the full nights value.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful boutiue hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: leesxo
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I took our second trip to Playa last April and stayed at the Blue Parrot 5th Ave. The year before we stayed at the beautiful, brand new at the time, Riu Palace Riviera Maya. We loved everything about the town so much, however, that we wanted to stay closer in our next trip. Below is everything we LOVED about our stay at Blue Parrot 5th Ave in Playa: 1)LOCATION! You walk out the front door and are literally among a sea of amazing bars, restaurants, shopping and 1 block off the gorgeous beach. The food everywhere is incredible, ranging from authentic mexican to fine italian and pizza joints. No matter what you're in the mood for, it's right outside your door... from thatched roof cantinas with swings at the bar, to swanky lounges to wine bars and beach clubs with DJs spinning lounge/house. The shopping is also unreal. I need not say more! 2) You get to use all the ammenities of the older sister hotel (Blue Parrot Beach Club) a block away right on the beach including the lounge chairs and towels, beachside service to the restaurants, free breakfast in the oceanside palapa, internet cafe, etc. This has to be the most beautiful ocean in all of Mexico. 3) The room! It's very modern with gorgeous marble floors, a red light that illuminates the shower area and plenty of storage including night stands, a closet and safe. 4)Playasia. The hotel retaurant is completely ambient with theatrical lighting, waterways and palapa huts. It's a French/Asian fusion style restaurant with excellent sushi. We had our engagement dinner in a private tree-house style table. It was so romatic! In Playa you won't find the typical Hilton or Sheraton. You'll either find the huge, all inclusive hotels mostly off the main drag in Playacar (a 50 peso, 10 minute cab ride) or the boutique hotels right in the middle of the action. f you're looking for the full service pools, bellmen at your becon call, and everything all on site, you probably want to look into an all inclusive in Playacar. If you want to experience the amazing ambiance, exciting beaches, food, drinks, shopping and fun Playa del Carmen has to offer, I'd definitely stay in town and at Blue Parrot 5th ave!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: nikidosland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at a neighboring hotel (posada mariposa) for 2 days prior to my stay at the blue parrot. It was about 15.00 less but horrible! I walked by the blue parrot and saw a promotional sign and a vacancy. I asked to see a room and was blown away! For 15.00 more dollars I went up about 3 stars! The room was super clean with modern furniture and decorations. Bottles of water were provided as well as tea light candles for relaxation. The bed was equally as comfortable as a bed at a resort. The location was fabulous. A block from the beach and right on 5th ave. Although it was right on 5th ave I heard no noise at night. A security gaurd is present at night and I felt incredibly safe which was important since I am female and was traveling alone. The only negatives is that the room didn't have a fridge and that the reception didn't open until 9 which caused me a bit of a problem with checking out in time to make my bus to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed longer. Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: stinker30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at the Blue Parrot on the beach on Saturday, June 16th. We decided on the 17th to stay one more night at the Blue Parrot and moved from the Suites to the 5th Ave. location to save some $$$. We were upgraded to the Suite for the same price as the deal they were on the studios. The suite at the 5th ave. location is wonderful. It was clean, quiet, has excellent a/c, mini bar, nice sitting/living area, spacious, comfy bed, etc. There was nothing bad about this room! The staff was wonderful as they had been all along (I'd been working with the Blue Parrot on a regular basis since Oct. 2006). I love the Blue Parrot. My advice is not to listen to the bad reviews! I was getting worried about having our wedding here after reading the bad reviews, but now I know that those were just a few angry people. Most people complain, not praise. Our wedding went wonderful at the Blue Parrot. The staff bent over backwards for us and our guests. An amazing time was had by all. I kept hearing over and over that it was the best wedding our guests had been to, that was a beautiful wedding, that everyone had a great time, etc. We also stayed at the Suites for 5 nights and give the suites a 5 also. We had 3 guests who stayed at the 5th ave. and had no complaints. Love the Blue Parrot!!!

Reviews.Title: “Same bad experience as sister hotel: Blue Parrot Beach, in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: J0seph74
Reviews.Content: Nothing more to say. The management of these 2 hotels needs to work very hard on improving their product. Book elsewhere: lots of other options in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “A Fake ..... don't go there”
Reviews.Author: padyeins
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a fake the pictures on the internet are not like in real the rooms are dirty and so small the furniture is so old ....the pool is so small in real and the water is brown all over the place is garbage and it stinks like a old toilet don't go to this place......

Reviews.Title: “We'd Return”
Reviews.Author: stillwatermn
Reviews.Content: Initially when I entered the room I was disappointed because of the small room size, lack of a chair and writing table, lack of ocean view, lack of good lighting. However, we came to really appreciate the Blue Parrot for several reasons: Convenience of a massage while enjoying an ocean view and ocean breezes with the sound of the waves. (Wonderful masseuse. Her name is Martina. Do get a massage as soon as you can. You will want a second. My massage was one of the best that I have ever had.) Quick, easy one block walk just one door down and around the corner to their beach access, the Blue Parrot Beach Club. Clean rest room at their beach. The location is mid Fifth Avenue location and is ideal for strolling Fifth Avenue and taking in the many restraurants and shops and making quick stops back and forth to our room. Fun, friendly, hard working staff catering to our beverage and food orders. Complimentary umbrellas, lounge chairs and beach towels available. We chose to tip well each day. Complimentary continental breakfasts on the deck with an ocean view with option to order from the menu. Entrance, shared by their restaurant, was attractive. Each time I opend our door in the morning I saw nothing but live green trees and plants. Air-conditioner muffled the evening music from the clubs on Fifth Ave and beach area. Room towels were a good quality and most linens seemed new. Clean linens and towels each day! Good bathroom ventilation. A safe in the room. Friendly staff. We toured the Blue Parrot Suites which are lovely, but I think if we return to Playa, I would still still stay at the Blue Parrot Fifth Ave. A few things we thought needed improvement: The room had only one towel rack and hook so towels had to be hung together. No hooks for long garments. Daily complimentary water was not provided. Only two keys were availlable so for the two days when we had an extra guest, we had to share keys. One English speaking TV Channel. The Academy Awards were in Spanish.

Reviews.Title: “not the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: glenk2901
Reviews.Content: The blue parrot organization is not the company to deal with.we were supposed tostay at the blue parrot on the beach. we called in nov ,after we heard about some trouble there.we were informed that there was no trouble with our reservation. one week before we arrived they phoned back saying they could not fufill our reservation ,and that we would have to stay at the 5th ave hotel instead.with no choices that is where we went.upon arrival we found this hotel not anything like we had reserved.there were no apolegies they just wanted our money.we were able to leave after three days.still no apolegies about the problems with our original res.we talked to several other people while holidaying,and found many others who had trouble with this organization.long story short, the best small hotel in playa would have to be the illusion hotel. great rooms and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Pricey”
Reviews.Author: pullhouse
Reviews.Content: The location is great, right on 5th Avenue. The courtyard is beautiful and we saw many tourists poking their heads in wishing that they stayed here. The rooms are refreshingly simple, nice high ceilings and a cool red-light in the shower. On the whole, we thought this hotel was a good place to stay. However, they had high holiday rates for our last few days (about $200+ per night) which is really outrageous. For those prices, I'd rather be at the much cooler Basico or Deseo across the street. The woman in the office in the morning was very helpful and very nice, but the man in the office in the afternoon seemed really bothered by simple questions. When I had a billing inquiry, he quipped about how a Belizean tourist ripped him off last week. Not really my problem and he never even answered my question. The woman in the morning straightened everything out beautifully. The bed springs could be felt through the mattress, which made for some rotten sleep. Relatively quite for 5th Avenue in Playa, which tends to be noisy. Continental Breakfast on the beach was included and very decent, but they couldn't provide us with any drinking water- unless we paid extra. When you're already paying the rates here, a little bit of water would go a long way to making the stay better. Overall, if you can forget about the price, it's OK to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: chicagotoots
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days at the Blue Parrot - location is great, beach, sun, swimming pools, staff is extraordinary, can walk everywhere from 5th Avenue to Walmart. The rooms are clean, comfortable, modern... you feel you are located in "real Mexico" but yet with the comforts of home. The staff was always smiling, did whatever they could to make you feel welcome and make your stay a great one. Do not recommend the rooms right off the street at the BP Hotel ... the noise travels down the street from the late night Clubs. Location is ideal! Good value for the money.

HotelInfo.Name: Blue Parrot 5th Avenue
HotelInfo.Address: 16st between 1st and 5th ave, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
